targets.expr:
histogram_quantile(
  0.99,
  sum by (le, stage)
    (rate(buildbuddy_remote_execution_executed_action_metadata_durations_usec_bucket{region="${region}", job="executor", stage!="worker", group_id=~"GR16310856858823099217|GR13567963851860390298|GR11301939955034629488"}[1m]))
)

panels.title: Invocations per second (by bazel exit code)

panels.description: Total number of bytes downloaded by consumers of the cache, per second. This does _not_ represent the average download speed across cache requests.
panels.title: Total downloaded bytes per second

panels.description: Total number of bytes uploaded by consumers of the cache, per second. This does _not_ represent the average upload speed across cache requests.
panels.title: Total uploaded bytes per second

panels.description: Avg age of last item evicted by the disk cache
panels.title: Disk Cache Avg Last Evicted Age
Disk Cache Duplicate Writes per Second
Files Added to Disk Cache by Size
SQL queries per second (by query template)
Median SQL query duration by query template
SQL error rate (errors per second / queries per second)
Average time spent by command per second
Total Time Spent by Command / sec
Num Execution Result Waiters (Sum Across Apps)
Num Execution Result Waiters (Max Across Apps)
HTTP requests per second by route
HTTP requests per second by method
HTTP responses per second by status
Median HTTP request handler duration (2xx responses only)

panels.description: Chart is stacked, so values always add up to 100%.

targets.expr: count(sum by (pod_name) (buildbuddy_remote_execution_tasks_executing{region="${region}", job="${pool}"}) > 0) / count(sum by (pod_name) (buildbuddy_remote_execution_tasks_executing{region="${region}", job="${pool}"}))

1 - count(sum by (pod_name) (buildbuddy_remote_execution_tasks_executing{region="${region}", job="${pool}"}) > 0) / count(sum by (pod_name) (buildbuddy_remote_execution_tasks_executing{region="${region}", job="${pool}"}))

panels.title: Fraction of working executors

targets.expr:
histogram_quantile(
  ${quantile},
  sum by (le, stage) (rate(buildbuddy_remote_execution_executed_action_metadata_durations_usec_bucket{region="${region}", stage!="worker", job="${pool}"}[${window}]))
)

panels.title: Task CPU usage (each 100% = 1 fully utilized core)

panels.description: Number of actions waiting to be executed
panels.title: Executor queue length by pod

panels.description: Number of heap bytes allocated and still in use.
panels.title: Heap size

panels.description: % of time spent in the garbage collector since the program started.
panels.title: GC CPU fraction
Handled gRPC requests per second by status
Handled gRPC requests per second by method

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(${quantile}, sum by (le, grpc_service, grpc_method) (grpc_server_handling_seconds_bucket{region="${region}", job="buildbuddy-app"}))

panels.title: gRPC client messages sent by method

panels.description: Measures the time spent handling build events. In a healthy state, this should be very small (on the order of microseconds) in most cases, since the build event handler needs to be very high throughput.
panels.title: Build event handler duration

panels.description: The number of rows Buildbuddy app writes to clickhouse.
panels.title: Clickhouse Insert Count by Table and Status
